_description: A single couplet translating ‘Planus sermo vsque ad cor penetrat, politus autem pascit aures’

BLHar665.Transcription: Playn word entereth the hertI florysched the eeres feedyt
BLHar665.Note: Above, the Latin, “Planus sermo vsque ad cor penetrat politus autem pascit aures,” and to right in margin, “Meus panis.”
BLHar665.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Middle English Versions of ‘Christe qui lux es’.” 
             Harvard Theological Review
         47 (1954): 55-63: 58.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 1.
